III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
2.) This facility is a court operated facility. It is not contracted with Michigan Department
of Health and Human Services therefore, MISEP requirements are not applicable.
3.) This facility is a court operated facility. It is not contracted with Michigan Department
of Health and Human Services therefore, contract/policy requirements are not
applicable.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility did not require technical assistance at this time.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility did not require consultation at this time.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
The facility was not required to submit any corrective action plans this licensing period
Interviews:
The Chief Administrator reported since the start of COVID the facility has had trouble
acquiring and maintaining staff for the CBT program. This program runs alongside the
detention. Because the detention has to be fully staffed at all times any staff hired
need to work in the detention when detention is short on staff. The Chief
Administrator continues to try and hire staff specifically for CBT. He reported when he
does hire staff they leave before he has a chance to get the program fully staffed.
Because the program is not staffed no other staff from this program could be
interviewed. For other staff and youth interviews see the interim report for Eaton
County Youth Facility’s detention program CO230201104.
1

VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules. It is recommended that the facility continue on their regular
authorization.
